*I have tried the following link procedure already and the problem is still there:*
<https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Plots.jl/issues/2886>
I also reinstalled Julia 1.5.3 and it didn’t help either…
Anyone has a clue? what else should I try?

text: yes it does

the error message
```dlopen(/Users/mahdimirhosseini/.julia/artifacts/2018f695f704168dba88d7630bf076a6ab66bcfb/lib/libx264.161.dylib, 1): image not found```
is incredibly unhelpful, but it isn't your fault, it's macos kernel fault

text: I see… So, there is nothing wrong with Julia. Should I wait for Apple to release a fix?

elements.text: I see… So, there is nothing wrong with Julia. Should I wait for Apple to release a fix?

text: not really.  it'd be great to know why _why_ the library can't be loaded, but that error message doesn't say anything

the library can't be loaded, but that error message doesn't say anything

text: on linux in this case I'd use `strace` to get some more information, but I don't think it exists for macos (but perhaps there is something similar?)

elements.text: on linux in this case I'd use
to get some more information, but I don't think it exists for macos (but perhaps there is something similar?)

text: I see… let me check.

```sandbox:${WORKSPACE} # otool -L libx264.161.dylib 
libx264.161.dylib:
        @rpath/libx264.161.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
        /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1213.0.0)```
`libx264.161.dylib` depends only on a system library, is it possible you don't have `/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib`?
